DOC.brief_summary: Shoulder pain common high prevalence general population . Subacromial Syndrome ( Shoulder Impingement Syndrome ( SIS ) ) frequent cause . SIS patient suffer pain , muscle weakness loss movement affect joint . Initial treatment SIS predominantly conservative . Surgical option high success rate often use conservative strategy fails . Traditional Physiotherapy Postoperative exercise need recovery joint range , muscle strength , stability functionality . This Research evaluate feasibility effectiveness telerehabilitati√≥n Program SIS surgery compare traditional therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Telerehabilitation Program Subacromial Syndrome ( Telerehab Sis )
DOC.detailed_description: In addition traditional physiotherapy , Telerehabilitation program proven effectiveness , validity , noninferiority important advantage various neurological , cognitive disease musculoskeletal disorder ; mean opportunity define new social intervention policy . Subjects randomly assign 1 ) Telerehabilitation Group 2 ) Traditional Therapy Group . After randomization , patient group receive initial evaluation . Data collect blinded evaluator . The Telerehabilitation group receive standardize customized exercise perform , web application allow Physiotherapist generate video , image parameter exercise program send via email patient . Telerehabilitation program describes exercise perform , number repetition depend level training criterion progression . Patients initially supervise physiotherapist conduct three training session individual videoconference , ensure proper execution exercise encourage patient adherence . Patients instructed perform self-workout video exercise follow Telerehabilitation program well support document call Telerehabilitation Manual Patient . Traditional group receive assistance physiotherapy center usual procedure rehabilitation Spain , personalize therapy consist 1 1 physical therapist exercise program home .
DOC.criteria: Adult 18 65 year Subacromial Syndrome Diagnosis ICD9 CM 726.10 , 726.12 , 726.19 issue specialist Orthopaedic Surgery Rehabilitation Specialist Receive Surgical Procedure ( arthroscopy open approach ( subacromial decompression partial acromioplasty , without coracoacromial release ) prescription rehabilitation process . He live Spain investigation period Provides home computer internet technology ( personal computer , laptop , tablet Smartphone ) Skills knowledge access email Previously Surgery intervention shoulder . Patients receive nonsurgical procedure base recommendation Subacromial Syndrome Unfit cognitive ability use technological tool
